Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2009 04:57AM dimc wrote: Susie, CONGRATULATIONS!  Hope you did the happy dance all the way out leaving the treatment center.  I'm interested to know how your rad mapping goes, I have my last chemo Aug 12 with mapping on Aug 20.  Have a terrific weekend....you made it!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2009 12:07PM dimc wrote: WEIGHT - UGH....gained at least 5 so far after just losing 10 this Spring.  Comfort foods are high on my list to.   NAILS....funny I'm contemplating getting a pedicure this week since we're on vacation next week.  Thought I'd go to a salon however instead of my usual nail chop shop.  At the Look Good Feel Better class I went to the salon owner who ran it said to make sure they use a hospital grade disinfectent to clean the tub, don't get your cuticles cut and you'll probably be OK.  I stopped my gel nails when treatment began and have just been having them cut nails and polish, no manicure.  Last TC treatment August 12th...yahoo!  Had round 3 last Tuesday, felt crappy Th-Fr-Sat but feeling OK today other than bad taste in mouth.  Stopped Emend premed this round as well because of headaches and it seemed to work.  Hang in there everyone....the light is right at the end of the tunnel!  Take care, have a great week.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2009 04:11AM dimc wrote: Had my last TC yesterday and I'm done!!!  It was very emotional.  I haven't cried since my diagnosis in the Spring so I guess it's how I cope.  I jump in and deal with it then it all catches up to me when it's over.  They were definitely tears of joy though.  I go for my Neulasta shot this morning, which will be my biggest challenge as usual.  Thanks again for everyone sharing their stories on this thread.  It's been a great help.  Have a great day everyone.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2009 05:48PM dimc wrote: Deborah....I'm so sorry you're experiencing so much trouble.  That just sucks.  Please see if your local cancer center or hospital has a group called the "red devils".  They can come out and clean your house.  I realize the flea thing is a totally separate problem, but once you get that under control look into that organization.  If it's not called the red devils maybe they go by another name in your area.  Utilize the resources that Komen puts in place at your local hospitals, etc....sometimes all you need to do is ask.  Hang in there honey!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee
